home.title: Minimal Translate Documentation
home.subtitle: Fast, minimal and powerful desktop translation app. Access instant translation from anywhere with global shortcut.
home.installationDesc: Detailed installation instructions for Windows, macOS and Linux
home.translateWindowDesc: Learn how to use the translate window
home.feature1Desc: Open translation window from anywhere with global shortcut key
home.feature2Desc: Support for hundreds of models via OpenAI, Google Gemini and OpenRouter
home.feature3Desc: Result is automatically copied to clipboard when translation completes
home.feature4Desc: Translate to any language you want
home.feature5Desc: Automatic refinement feature for English translations
home.feature6Desc: Create and use your own translation prompts
home.quickStart3: Open translation window by pressing shortcut key (default: {{shortcut}})

installation.title: Installation
installation.subtitle: Follow the instructions below to install Minimal Translate on your Windows, macOS or Linux operating system.
installation.installStep1: Double-click the downloaded file to start the installation wizard
installation.installStep3: Launch the application after installation is complete
installation.portableStep1: Move the downloaded file to any folder you want
installation.portableStep2: Double-click the file to run the application
installation.portableNote: Portable version does not require installation
installation.macStep1: Open the DMG file (usually opens automatically)
installation.macStep2: Drag the application to the Applications folder
installation.macStep3: Run Minimal Translate from the Applications folder
installation.macSecurityNote: macOS may show a security warning on first run. In this case:
installation.macSecurity1: Go to System Preferences ‚Üí Security & Privacy ‚Üí General
installation.linuxAppImageStep1: Give execute permission to the downloaded file:
installation.linuxAppImageStep2: Run by double-clicking or from terminal:
installation.linuxAppImageNote: AppImage does not require installation, it's a portable format
installation.linuxDebStep3: Launch the application from the application menu
installation.afterInstallStep1: When you start the application, an icon will appear in the system tray
installation.afterInstallStep2: Access the settings panel by clicking the icon or right-clicking and selecting "Settings"
installation.afterInstallStep3: section to add an API key for the translation service you want to use
installation.afterInstallStep4: section to select the model you want to use
installation.afterInstallStep5: section to set your preferred shortcut combination (default: {{shortcut}})
installation.afterInstallStep6: You can now open the translate window by pressing the shortcut key!

translateWindow.title: Translate Window
translateWindow.subtitle: The translate window is the main interface of Minimal Translate. You can quickly access it with a global shortcut and translate instantly.
translateWindow.openingDesc: To open the translate window, use the default shortcut key combination:
translateWindow.shortcutNote: You can customize the shortcut key from the Keyboard Shortcuts section.
translateWindow.textInputDesc: When the window opens, the text input field is automatically focused. You can type or paste the text you want to translate.
translateWindow.textInputNote3: You can use Ctrl+V or Cmd+V for pasting
translateWindow.modelSelectionDesc: You can select the AI model you want to use for translation from the dropdown menu at the top of the window.
translateWindow.modelSelectionNote3: Hundreds of models accessible via OpenRouter
translateWindow.modelSelectionNote4: Selected model is saved in settings
translateWindow.modelSelectionLink: See the AI Models page for detailed information.
translateWindow.refineModeDesc: Refinement mode makes translations more natural and fluent for English translations. You can toggle it on/off with the toggle button.
translateWindow.refineModeNote1: Refinement mode only works for English translations
translateWindow.refineModeNote3: Can be changed individually for each translation
translateWindow.translateDesc: After typing the text, to translate:
translateWindow.translateStep1: Press Enter key (you can add a new line with Shift+Enter)
translateWindow.translateResult1: Result is automatically copied to clipboard
translateWindow.closingStep2: Click outside the window (on the background)
translateWindow.closingStep3: It closes automatically after translation is complete
translateWindow.settingsDesc: You can access the settings panel by clicking the "Settings" button at the bottom right of the window.
translateWindow.tip1: When translating, the window automatically focuses, so you can start typing directly
translateWindow.tip2: Since the translation result is automatically copied to clipboard, you can immediately paste it with Ctrl+V
translateWindow.tip3: The window always opens at its last position
translateWindow.tip4: Use keyboard shortcuts for quick translations (Enter: translate, ESC: close)

howToUse.subtitle: Using Minimal Translate is very simple. Follow the steps below to quickly start translating.
howToUse.useShortcutDesc: Press the default shortcut keys anywhere:
howToUse.shortcutCustomize: Note: You can customize the shortcut from the {{link}} section.
howToUse.typeTextDesc: Type or paste the text you want to translate in the opened translation window.
howToUse.pressEnterDesc: Translation will start automatically and the result will be displayed.
howToUse.pressEnterNote: Note: Use Shift+Enter to add a new line.
howToUse.pasteDesc: When translation is complete, the result is automatically copied to clipboard. You can paste it anywhere you want:
howToUse.tip1: You can close the translation window with the ESC key
howToUse.tip2: You can also close it by clicking outside the window
howToUse.tip3: Result is automatically copied to clipboard when translation completes
howToUse.tip4: Source language is automatically detected, no need for manual selection
howToUse.tip5: When the window opens, it automatically focuses, so you can start typing directly
howToUse.tip6: You can make English translations more natural by enabling refinement mode

aiModels.subtitle: Minimal Translate supports different AI models for translation. You can optimize translation quality by selecting the model you want.
aiModels.openaiDesc: Advanced AI model capable of contextual translation. Understands idioms and nuances.
aiModels.openaiNote: API key required. You can add it from the {{link}} section.
aiModels.geminiDesc: Advanced AI translation engine. Ideal for complex texts.
aiModels.geminiFeature1: Gemini Pro and other Gemini models
aiModels.openrouterDesc: Access many AI models with a single API. Hundreds of different model options.
aiModels.modelSelectionStep1: Go to the AI Models page in the settings panel
aiModels.modelSelectionStep2: Click on the model card you want to use
aiModels.openrouterSelectionDesc: If you selected OpenRouter, you can additionally specify which model you want to use:
aiModels.openrouterStep1: Search Model: Filter by typing the model name in the search box
aiModels.openrouterStep2: Free Filter: Activate the filter to see only free models
aiModels.openrouterStep3: Select Model: Select a model from the list
aiModels.openrouterStep4: Custom Model ID: Enter the model ID to use a model not in the list
aiModels.openrouterNote: Note: Make sure your API key is defined in the API Keys section for the model you selected.
aiModels.modelChangeDesc: You can also change the model in the translation window:
aiModels.modelChangeStep2: Select the model you want from the model selector dropdown menu at the top
aiModels.modelChangeStep3: Selection is automatically saved and will be used in subsequent translations

apiKeys.subtitle: Minimal Translate requires API keys to perform translations. You need to add a valid API key for each service.
apiKeys.generalInfoDesc: Your API keys are encrypted and stored securely using system secure storage. Your keys are never shared with third parties.
apiKeys.securityNote: Security: All API keys are encrypted using Electron's secure storage feature. Your keys are stored locally and never sent to servers.
apiKeys.openaiDesc: To get an OpenAI API key:
apiKeys.openaiStep1: Go to the OpenAI Platform API Keys page
apiKeys.openaiStep2: Sign in or create an account
apiKeys.openaiStep3: Click the "Create new secret key" button
apiKeys.openaiStep5: Copy the created API key (only shown once!)
apiKeys.openaiStep6: Go to the API Keys page in the settings panel
apiKeys.openaiStep7: Paste the key into the OpenAI field
apiKeys.openaiStep8: Click the "Test" button to verify the key is valid
apiKeys.openaiNote: Note: OpenAI API usage is paid. Visit the OpenAI Pricing page for pricing.
apiKeys.geminiDesc: To get a Google Gemini API key:
apiKeys.geminiStep1: Go to the Google AI Studio page
apiKeys.geminiStep2: Sign in with your Google account
apiKeys.geminiStep4: Select a project or create a new project
apiKeys.geminiStep6: Go to the API Keys page in the settings panel
apiKeys.geminiStep7: Paste the key into the Gemini field
apiKeys.geminiStep8: Click the "Test" button to verify the key is valid
apiKeys.geminiNote: Note: Gemini API has a free usage quota. Visit the Google AI Studio page for details.
apiKeys.openrouterDesc: To get an OpenRouter API key:
apiKeys.openrouterStep2: Sign in or create an account
apiKeys.openrouterStep3: Go to the API Keys page
apiKeys.openrouterStep7: Go to the API Keys page in the settings panel
apiKeys.openrouterStep8: Paste the key into the OpenRouter field
apiKeys.openrouterStep9: Click the "Test" button to verify the key is valid
apiKeys.openrouterNote: Note: OpenRouter uses different pricing for different models. Some models are free. Visit the OpenRouter Pricing page for details.
apiKeys.addUpdateStep1: Paste your API key into the relevant service field
apiKeys.addUpdateStep2: Click the "Test" button to check the key's validity
apiKeys.addUpdateStep3: Click the "Save" button when the test is successful
apiKeys.addUpdateStep4: The key is encrypted and stored securely
apiKeys.viewHideDesc: API keys are hidden by default for security. To view:
apiKeys.viewHideStep1: Click the eye icon to the right of the key field
apiKeys.viewHideStep2: The key will be displayed as text
apiKeys.viewHideStep3: Click the same icon again to hide it
apiKeys.testDesc: You can test to make sure your API key is valid:
apiKeys.testStep1: Paste the key into the field
apiKeys.testStep3: Test result will be shown as successful or failed
apiKeys.testStep4: Error messages are displayed for failed tests

translation.subtitle: You can configure the target language and refinement mode with translation settings.
translation.targetLanguageDesc: You can select the target language for translations. Minimal Translate offers 100+ language support.
translation.targetLanguageStep1: Go to the Translation Settings page in the settings panel
translation.targetLanguageStep2: Select the language you want from the Target Language dropdown menu
translation.targetLanguageNote: Note: When a target language is selected, all translations will be made to that language. Source language is automatically detected.
translation.refineModeDesc: Refinement mode makes English translations more natural and fluent. An additional refinement step is performed after translation is done.
translation.refineModeActivateStep1: Go to the Translation Settings page in the settings panel
translation.refineModeActivateStep2: Turn on the toggle button in the Refinement Mode section
translation.refineModeHow1: Refinement mode only works for English translations
translation.refineModeHow2: After translation is done, the translation text is reprocessed by AI
translation.refineModeHow3: A more natural, fluent and professional translation is obtained
translation.refineModeHow4: The refinement process may take a bit longer
translation.refineModeTip: Tip: API usage may increase when refinement mode is on. You can quickly turn it on/off from the translation window if needed.
translation.fromWindowDesc: You can also change some settings while translating:
translation.fromWindow1: Model Selection: You can select a different model from the dropdown menu at the top of the window
translation.fromWindow2: Refinement Mode: You can turn it on/off with the toggle button
translation.fromWindow3: These changes are automatically saved and will be used in subsequent translations
translation.examplesDesc: An example translation is shown for the target language you selected on the settings page. This helps you verify the language selection.
translation.examplesNote: Example: The sentence "There is a meeting tomorrow. Will you be attending?" is translated and displayed in your selected target language.

shortcuts.subtitle: You can determine the key combination you will use to open the translation window by customizing the shortcut keys.
shortcuts.defaultShortcutDesc: Minimal Translate uses the following shortcut key by default:
shortcuts.defaultShortcutNote: This shortcut works globally, meaning you can use it even while in any application.
shortcuts.changeShortcutDesc: To set a custom shortcut key combination:
shortcuts.changeShortcutStep1: Go to the Keyboard Shortcuts page in the settings panel
shortcuts.changeShortcutStep2: Click the "Set New Shortcut" or similar button
shortcuts.changeShortcutStep3: Record mode will be active and "Press keys" message will appear
shortcuts.changeShortcutStep4: Press the key combination you want
shortcuts.changeShortcutStep7: Shortcut is saved and becomes active
shortcuts.changeShortcutWarning: Warning: If you select a shortcut used by the system or another application, an error message will be displayed. Try a different combination.
shortcuts.supportedKeysDesc: Keys you can use in shortcut combinations:
shortcuts.supportedKeysNote: Note: Shortcut must contain at least one modifier key (Ctrl/Cmd, Shift, Alt) and one character key.
shortcuts.testShortcutStep2: Press the shortcut key combination you saved
shortcuts.testShortcutStep3: You should see the translation window open
shortcuts.testShortcutStep4: If it doesn't open, check that the shortcut isn't being used by another application
shortcuts.shortcutTip1: Choose a shortcut that is easy to remember and accessible
shortcuts.shortcutTip2: Use combinations that don't conflict with system shortcuts
shortcuts.shortcutTip4: If you accidentally press a key during recording, click "Cancel" and try again

prompts.subtitle: You can customize how the AI model will translate by creating custom translation prompts. You can create up to 5 custom prompts.
prompts.whatIsPromptDesc: A prompt is the instruction text sent to the AI model. Minimal Translate uses a default prompt, but you can customize the translation style by creating custom prompts.
prompts.whatIsPromptExample: Example: You can create prompts containing instructions like "Translate this text in a formal tone" or "Make this translation in everyday conversation language".
prompts.createPromptDesc: To create a new custom prompt:
prompts.createPromptStep1: Go to the Prompt Settings page in the settings panel
prompts.createPromptStep2: Click the "Add New" or similar button
prompts.createPromptStep3a: Name: Enter a name for your prompt
prompts.createPromptStep5: Prompt is added to your list
prompts.createPromptLimit: Limit: You can create up to 5 custom prompts. When you reach this limit, you need to delete an existing prompt first to add a new one.
prompts.selectPromptDesc: You can select one of your created prompts as default:
prompts.selectPromptStep1: Select the prompt you want to use from the prompt list
prompts.selectPromptStep2: Selected prompt is highlighted and becomes active
prompts.selectPromptStep3: This prompt will be used in all translations
prompts.selectPromptStep4: Select the "None" option to return to default prompt
prompts.editPromptStep1: Click the "Edit" button next to the prompt you want to edit
prompts.editPromptStep2: Change the name and content in the modal window
prompts.deletePromptStep1: Click the "Delete" button next to the prompt you want to delete
prompts.deletePromptStep2: Click the "Delete" button in the confirmation message
prompts.deletePromptStep3: Prompt is removed from the list
prompts.deletePromptStep4: If the deleted prompt was active, automatically returns to default prompt
prompts.example1Content: Translate this text in a formal and professional tone. Use appropriate language for business emails and official documents.
prompts.example2Content: Translate this text in everyday conversation language. Use a friendly and natural tone, like conversation between friends.
prompts.example3Content: When translating this text, preserve technical terms and proper nouns in their original form. Only translate translatable parts.
prompts.promptTip1: Write your prompt content clearly and concisely
prompts.promptTip2: Create different prompts for different scenarios
prompts.promptTip4: Optimize your prompts by testing translation quality

notifications.subtitle: You can configure notification settings to receive notifications when translation is complete.
notifications.enableDesc: To receive a system notification when translation is complete:
notifications.enableStep1: Go to the Notifications page in the settings panel
notifications.enableStep2: Turn on the "Send Notifications" toggle button
notifications.enableStep3: If opening for the first time, the system will request notification permission
notifications.enableStep4: Select "Allow" or "Allow" option in the permission window
notifications.enableNote: Note: If notification permission was not granted, you will be redirected to system settings. You may need to grant permission manually.
notifications.grantPermissionDesc: Steps to grant notification permission according to your operating system:
notifications.macosStep1: System Preferences ‚Üí Notifications & Focus ‚Üí Minimal Translate
notifications.windowsStep2: Turn on notifications for Minimal Translate
notifications.linuxStep1: Go to the notifications section in your system settings
notifications.linuxStep2: Grant notification permission for Minimal Translate
notifications.linuxStep3: Note: Steps may vary depending on Linux distribution
notifications.grantPermissionQuickAccess: Quick Access: You can go directly to system settings by clicking the "Open System Settings" button on the Notifications page.
notifications.howItWorksDesc: Notifications are shown in the following cases:
notifications.howItWorks2: When translation result is copied to clipboard
notifications.howItWorks3: If notification permission is granted and notifications are active
notifications.howItWorksNote: Notifications are shown even if the translation window is open. This way, you will know that the translation is complete even if you closed the window.
notifications.disableStep1: Go to the Notifications page in the settings panel
notifications.disableStep2: Turn off the "Send Notifications" toggle button
notifications.disableStep4: Notifications will no longer be shown when translation is complete
notifications.statusDesc: Statuses you can see on the Notifications page:
notifications.statusActive: Active: Notifications are on and permission is granted
notifications.statusPending: Permission Pending: Notifications are on but system permission has not been granted yet
notifications.statusDenied: Denied: Notification permission was denied, you need to turn it on from system settings
